data.title: Why can't I get into Game Center, my screen just shows white?
data.meta_description:
Why can't I get into Game Center My screen just shows white

I upgraded to IOS 9 and now Game Center only shows a white screen can't play some of my games
data.text:
Re: Why can't I get into Game Center My screen just shows white

I can't get into Game Center on settings

Go to Settings and tap Game Center

Then tap your email Apple ID

Then sign out, then sign back in..

But Game Center in settings just freezes the settings app. How can we log out, and then back in if we can't even get into Game Center in settings?

I've seen quite a few people with this problem. Resetting all settings and restarting the phone doesn't work either. Apple obviously needs to fix this. 9.3 maybe?

But Game Center in settings just freezes the settings app. How can we log out, and then back in if we can't even get into Game Center in settings?

I've seen quite a few people with this problem. Resetting all settings and restarting the phone doesn't work either. Apple obviously needs to fix this. 9.3 maybe?

How does Game Center freeze the Settings App? What do you mean by that? I've never heard of such happening. It doesn't on my phone. Follow the instructions above. You log out of Game Center in Settings.

How does Game Center freeze the Settings App? What do you mean by that? I've never heard of such happening. It doesn't on my phone. Follow the instructions above. You log out of Game Center in Settings.

You didn't read what I posted. I can't "log out of Game Center in settings"... because as soon as I tap on it, the settings app locks up (freezes)

In settings, I scroll down to Game Center, tap on it, and it freezes right there. The settings app itself locks up and I can't do anything else. I have to force close the settings app to recover.

With that said, I just received the 9.2.1 update and am installing it now. I hope it fixes this!

Welp, no dice! 9.2.1 did not fix the problem...

How does Game Center freeze the Settings App? What do you mean by that?

Here ya go, I whipped up a little video demonstration of the issue:

I would like attention brought to this. Mine has been "dead" for a while. I would really like a fix. Here is a thread I found that has been going on for a while on Apple support. There was a "fix" posted a couple of days ago but it didn't work for me.

https://

discussions.

apple

.com

/thread/7218355?start=315&tstart=0

My post count is too low so I hope that works.

There's a bunch of people in this thread that have experienced the freezing settings app when trying to access Game Center settings.

http://forums.imore.com/ios-9/34078...e-center-doesn-t-work-what-could-problem.html

Odd for sure. I don?t see that on my 6s Plus. I don't think it's wide spread. Obviously some do have the issue though. I would first try Reset All Settings.

Reset All Settings

Go to Settings >General >Reset >Reset All Settings. This resets to default everything in Settings, including notifications, alerts, brightness, and clock settings like wake up alarms.

If that doesn't work, you may need to restore your phone as new. Not from a back up. It's a PITA, but it fixes many issues. I did it 3 days after I got my 6s Plus in September.

This too:

https://discussions.apple.com/thread/5431334?tstart=0
